result.execSummary:
The defendant Zacchaues Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "C" Felony], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fess and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.   DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with the victim Tecola L. or her address.
No contact with the coactors Dangelo Jones, Kaasie Brown, Marquell Good and Shawn Jones.

Comply with the standard rules of Extended supervision.
Restitution set at zero.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Provide a DNA sample, pay surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zacchaues Davis in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Zacchaues Davis in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Statements made by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to the Wisconsin State Prison for a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, with credit for 71 DAYS time served.  Court ordered 4 YEARS for the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT and 6 YEARS of EXTENDED SUPERVISION.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim,Tecola L., or her address.
* No contact with the co-actors, Dangelo Jones, Kaasie Brown, Marquell Good, and Shawn Jones.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Zacchaues Davis in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Zacchaues Davis in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
RISK ASSESSMENT filed by ADA Joy Hammond on behalf of the State.

Attorney Vincent P Guimont in court, defendant Zacchaues Davis not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today, however, the parties are unable to proceed.
Judge Donald is currently in trial on an unrelated matter.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-09-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Zacchaues Davis in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Zacchaues Davis in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/9/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TECORA L. AND HER CHILDREN.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Zacchaues Davis in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Zacchaues Davis in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
